result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert L Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Submit a DNA sample if not already done.  Pay all costs and surcharges, including mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid from out of up to 25% of prison wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Voting admonishment and firearms warning given.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Albert L Coleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (39 pages) commencing MAY 20, 2014, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Albert L Coleman in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Albert L Coleman in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.      Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.    The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 42 months, concurrent with any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 128 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample  if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Albert L Coleman in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Albert L Coleman in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM MSDF FOR PURPOSES OF THE FINAL PRETRIAL AND JURY TRIAL IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, Defendant Albert L Coleman not in court, in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for Hanna R Kolberg for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from MSDF for purposes of this hearing. Case adjourned for a Jury Trial and Final Pretrial Hearing in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Albert L Coleman in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Albert L Coleman in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kyle Jelinek-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling Conference on February 28, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 26.

Defendant Albert L Coleman in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Albert L Coleman in custody.  Paul Hauer for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Stipulation to a requested adjournment is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Albert L Coleman in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Albert L Coleman in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
